lines.text: We are in quaint St. Augustine, the pride of Florida and the oldest permanent white settlement in the United States, where the architecture of old Spain has been faithfully reproduced and preserved as one of the most colorful heritages of North America.

The armies of the old world that once dominated our country are to us but the ghosts of yesterday, merely reminding us of a liberation from force and dictatorship, which is now the priceless heritage of all those who are fortunate enough to live under the protection of the Stars and Stripes.
